content.formatted_body:
CharacterClassEscape[UnicodeMode] :: [+UnicodeMode] p{ UnicodePropertyValueExpression } [+UnicodeMode] P{ UnicodePropertyValueExpression }

Is it missing a [+UnicodeSetsMode] version of those 2 production? otherwise I cannot find a way to parse /^\p{Basic_Emoji}+$/v

m.new_content.formatted_body:
CharacterClassEscape[UnicodeMode] :: 
[+UnicodeMode] p{ UnicodePropertyValueExpression }
[+UnicodeMode] P{ UnicodePropertyValueExpression }

Is it missing a [+UnicodeSetsMode] version of those 2 production? otherwise I cannot find a way to parse /^\p{Basic_Emoji}+$/v

content.body: In the spec, `+UnicodeSetsMode` only occurs in conjunction with `+UnicodeMode`. (i.e., roughly, `USM` implies `+UM`, or `+USM` is a subset of `+UM`), so any RHS guarded by `[+UM]` 'succeeds' for all cases of `+USM`.
content.formatted_body: In the spec, +UnicodeSetsMode only occurs in conjunction with +UnicodeMode. (i.e., roughly, USM implies +UM, or +USM is a subset of +UM), so any RHS guarded by [+UM] 'succeeds' for all cases of +USM.

content.body: oh, I checked all Pattern, all Pattern[+USM] is also marked as [+UM]
